Kremlin Urges 'Careful Use Of Nuclear Rhetoric' As Medvedev Pivots To Saying Trump Blackmailed By Mossad
summary: Kremlin Urges 'Careful Use Of Nuclear Rhetoric' As Medvedev Pivots To Saying Trump Blackmailed By Mossad div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted f.
fullContent: Kremlin Urges 'Careful Use Of Nuclear Rhetoric' As Medvedev Pivots To Saying Trump Blackmailed By Mossad The Kremlin has issued a fresh statement urging caution in making public statements involving nuclear weapons, after last week President Trump ordered two US nuclear submarines to deploy "closer to Russia". Seeking to downplay tensions, Putin spokesman Dmitry Peskov stated of the ultra-provocative American sub deployment, "in this case, it is obvious that American submarines are already on combat patrol. This is a constant process." He stressed that Moscow would prefer not to engage in such discourse or "get involved in such a controversy in any way," according to state media. AFP via Getty Images "We are very careful about any statements related to nuclear issues" given that "Russia takes a responsible position" and is "very attentive to the topic of nuclear non-proliferation," he added. He said that on the nuclear issue, "the main thing, of course, is the position of President Putin" - suggesting that he is the final, responsible decision-maker on use of strategic doctrine. "We believe that everyone should be very, very careful with nuclear rhetoric," Peskov then emphasized further. Interestingly it was Trump himself who last week accused former Russian president Dmitry Medvedev of throwing around nuclear threats lightly. Medvedev - who currently serves deputy chair of the country's Security Council - made reference to atomic apocalypse in written social media remarks about the Ukraine war and standoff with Washington. "Well, a former president of Russia who's now in charge of one of the most important councils, Medvedev, said some things that were very bad, talking about nuclear," Trump had said in a follow-up interview about the matter. Trump continued, "And when you mention the word 'nuclear,' you know, my eyes light up and I say, 'We better be careful,' because it's the ultimate threat." So now it appears at least both rivals are on the same page - with Moscow and Washington simultaneously calling for the dialing back of all nuclear rhetoric. But this doesn't mean that Medvedev is done going after Trump in this latest tit-for-tat social media public war or words. He put the following out Monday on Telegram: ‚ÄúTrump should not think that the video archive of his past immoralities is only in the hands of Mossad.‚Äù This is to apparently suggest strongly that Trump's foreign policy actions are directed by Israel, in connection with Epstein-related blackmail, and is among the more bizarre and aggressive theories thrown out there by Medvedev of late. üö® Medvedev: ‚ÄúTrump shouldn‚Äôt think the video archive of his past immoralities is only in Mossad‚Äôs hands.‚Äù üá∑üá∫‚ö†Ô∏èüá∫üá∏ pic.twitter.com/4MPSuCldSk ‚Äî Daily Iran News (@DailyIranNews) August 3, 2025 For all of this to cool down, it will probably take Trump not responding to this latest provocative statement and insult by Medvedev. Given he's long sought to ignore and bat down the Epstein case, there's a good chance that Trump will let this statement pass without firing back. Tyler Durden Mon, 08/04/2025 - 14:25

title: Elon Musk Unveils Grok Update After Controversial Posts By The AI Chatbot
summary: Elon Musk Unveils Grok Update After Controversial Posts By The AI Chatbot div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--ty.
fullContent: Elon Musk Unveils Grok Update After Controversial Posts By The AI Chatbot Authored by Jack Phillips via The Epoch Times (emphasis ours), Tech billionaire Elon Musk on Wednesday unveiled a new update to his Grok AI chatbot, a day after it posted controversial content across social media platform X. Elon Musk looks on during a news conference in the Oval Office of the White House on May 30, 2025. Allison Robbert/AFP via Getty Images Earlier this week, Grok 3 made allegedly anti-Semitic comments, cited what appeared to be false information about an X user in connection with the recent deadly floods in Texas, made statements praising Adolf Hitler, and at one point, described itself as ‚ÄúMechaHitler,‚Äù causing the term to trend on X on Tuesday. Musk‚Äôs xAI company, which develops the chatbot, released a statement Tuesday on the Grok account, saying it is ‚Äúactively working to remove the inappropriate posts‚Äù and has ‚Äútaken action to ban hate speech before Grok posts on X.‚Äù ‚ÄúGrok 4 is the first time, in my experience, that an AI has been able to solve difficult, real-world engineering questions where the answers cannot be found anywhere on the Internet or in books. And it will get much better,‚Äù Musk wrote in a post on Thursday. In a livestreamed event, Musk also touted the capabilities of the latest Grok update, calling Grok 4 ‚Äúthe smartest AI in the world.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt really is remarkable to see the advancement of artificial intelligence, how quickly it is evolving,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI would expect Grok to discover new technologies that are actually useful no later than next year, and maybe end of this year. And it might discover new physics next year.‚Äù Responding to the controversy over the recent posts, Musk said that the comments posted by Grok 3 earlier in the week were because the chatbot was ‚Äútoo compliant to user prompts. Too eager to please and be manipulated.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat is being addressed,‚Äù Musk wrote in a July 9 post on X. Musk last month promised to upgrade Grok, suggesting there was ‚Äúfar too much garbage in any foundation model trained on uncorrected data.‚Äù The announcement from Musk follows high-profile AI advancements that were released by Google, OpenAI, and other tech companies in recent months. Big tech companies have been spending heavily on AI as they view the new technology as a major growth engine, while slashing costs elsewhere to safeguard profits. Some current and former employees at OpenAI and Google warned in an open letter that ‚Äúserious risks‚Äù could be posed by AI and called for greater protections. The letter warned that AI could lead to ‚Äúthe further entrenchment of existing inequalities, to manipulation and misinformation, to the loss of control of autonomous AI systems potentially resulting in human extinction.‚Äù During the Grok 4 launch, Musk briefly referred to AI safety and said that he wants Grok to be ‚Äúmaximally truth-seeking.‚Äù On Wednesday, X CEO Linda Yaccarino stepped down from the company, though there was no known connection between her decision and the content posted by Grok. She did not refer to the Grok controversy in her farewell statement, posted to her account. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm incredibly proud of the X team - the historic business turn around we have accomplished together has been nothing short of remarkable,‚Äù she wrote. Reuters contributed to this report. Tyler Durden Mon, 08/04/2025 - 14:05

Tom Lee's BitMine Holdings Top $3 Billion In Largest Global Ethereum Treasury Strategy
summary: Tom Lee's BitMine Holdings Top $3 Billion In Largest Global Ethereum Treasury Strategy div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-b.
fullContent: Tom Lee's BitMine Holdings Top $3 Billion In Largest Global Ethereum Treasury Strategy Aside from Friday's sudden net outflow, the month of Ethereum's tenth anniversary was celebrated by an almost unstoppable wave of net inflows into ETFs... And, perhaps even more notably, an ongoing demand from Altcoin Treasury Strategy companies is also gaining momentum with Ethereum treasury firm BitMine Immersion Technologies (BMNR) said its ether holdings have climbed to about 833,000 tokens currently worth more than $2.9 billion, making the Tom Lee‚Äìbacked company the world‚Äôs largest public holder of ETH. Source: The Block Fundstrat co-founder Tom Lee, who is now the Chairman of BitMine‚Äôs board of directors, says the firm is pushing to acquire 5% of the circulating supply of Ethereum, which would be about 6,035,480 ETH. ‚ÄúBitMine moved with lightning speed in its pursuit of the ‚Äòalchemy of 5%‚Äô of ETH growing our ETH holdings to over 833,000 from zero 35 days ago. We have separated ourselves among crypto treasury peers by both the velocity of raising crypto NAV per share and by the high liquidity of our stock.‚Äù Ethereum is surging higher this morning on the heels of this news... Continuing its recent strong outperformance trend over bitcoin... As a reminder, Standard Chartered forecasts Ethereum Treasury holdings to top 10% of supply: For ETH this is likely to happen more quickly, as the broader concept of corporate holdings of digital assets is already accepted. Publicly listed Bitcoin mining company, BitMine Immersion Tech (BMNR), is currently the largest Ether treasury firm, holding 0.5% of the circulating ETH supply. If BMNR can achieve its goal of increasing its ETH holdings to 5% of the total in circulation, then it is fair to assume that ETH treasury companies as a whole will end up holding more than 10% of all ETH in circulation. This would be a 10x increase from today‚Äôs corporate treasury holdings. Ether-focused treasury firms have more growth potential compared to Bitcoin treasury firms from a ‚Äúregulatory arbitrage perspective,‚Äù according to Standard Chartered. "...this buying of digital assets by corporates makes sense due to inefficiencies in financial markets, mostly stemming from regulation. Specifically, restrictions on investor access to the asset class, which remain significant in a large number of jurisdictions, mean that investors seek alternative vehicles (in this case publicly listed companies) through which to gain exposure to the underlying asset. As a result, these companies‚Äô market cap tends to trade above the net asset value (NAV) of the assets held, at a so-called positive NAV multiple." Ether treasury firms can ‚Äúcapture both staking rewards and decentralised finance (DeFi) leverage opportunities, which US Ethereum ETFs currently cannot.‚Äù In terms of next potential catalysts, we will be looking at the upcoming Fusaka protocol upgrade in Q4‚Äô25. Tyler Durden Mon, 08/04/2025 - 13:45

title: #Trump deploys nuclear submarines in response to #Russia #shorts
EPA's Lee Zeldin Defends Proposal To Repeal Climate Regulation
summary: EPA's Lee Zeldin Defends Proposal To Repeal Climate Regulation div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-wit.
fullContent: EPA's Lee Zeldin Defends Proposal To Repeal Climate Regulation Authored by Victoria Friedman via The Epoch Times (emphasis ours), Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Administrator Lee Zeldin on Sunday defended plans to repeal the agency‚Äôs Obama-era ‚Äúendangerment findings‚Äú that link motor vehicle emissions to changes in the climate and underpin related regulations. EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin attends a Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) Commission Event in the East Room of the White House in Washington on May 22, 2025. Jacquelyn Martin/AP Photo Zeldin told CNN‚Äôs ‚ÄúState of the Union‚Äù that to reach the 2009 endangerment findings, officials ‚Äúrelied on the most pessimistic views of the science.‚Äù He added that a lot of those views did not pan out and that his proposals ‚Äúrely on 2025 facts, as opposed to 2009 bad assumptions.‚Äù On July 29, Zeldin proposed repealing the findings, saying during a visit to an auto dealership in Indiana that doing so would ‚Äúend 16 years of uncertainty for automakers and American consumers.‚Äù According to the EPA, if the proposal goes ahead, it would repeal $1 trillion in regulations, saving $54 billion annually. The plans followed Zeldin‚Äôs announcement in June that his administration would start relaxing Clean Power Plant greenhouse gas and mercury emission regulations, which were imposed under the Biden and Obama administrations. These regulations would have required power plants to ‚Äúcapture‚Äù 40 percent of their emissions by 2032 and increase that to 90 percent by 2039, which Zeldin said would cost coal- and gas-fired plants upward of $1 billion a year. Two Findings According to the EPA‚Äôs website, the agency relied on two findings‚Äîsigned in December 2009 under a section of the Clean Air Act‚Äîto impose regulations on greenhouse gas emissions standards for vehicles and other sectors. The first finding said ‚Äúcurrent and projected concentrations‚Äù of six well-mixed greenhouse gases‚Äîincluding carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide‚Äîin the atmosphere threatened public health and welfare. The second found that the combined emissions from new motor vehicles and new motor vehicle engines contributed to greenhouse gas pollution. ‚ÄúThese findings do not themselves impose any requirements on industry or other entities,‚Äù the EPA stated. ‚ÄúHowever, this action was a prerequisite for implementing greenhouse gas emissions standards for vehicles and other sectors.‚Äù Zeldin told ‚ÄúState of the Nation‚Äù that previous government officials had made ‚Äúa lot of mental leaps‚Äù in order to justify the findings. ‚ÄúThey say carbon dioxide, when mixed with a whole bunch of other well-mixed gases, in some cases not even emitted from mobile sources ... contributes to global climate change. It doesn‚Äôt say causes, [it says] ‚Äòcontributes.‚Äô How much, they don‚Äôt say, but it‚Äôs north of zero‚Äînot much more than zero,‚Äù Zeldin said. Vague Language Zeldin added that the EPA could not use vague language in statutes to make mandates, and that regulating ‚Äúmobile sources‚Äù of pollution, such as automobiles, was a matter that would ultimately need to be addressed by Congress. ‚ÄúThe power comes from the law. I don‚Äôt get to just make up the law,‚Äù he said. Zeldin added that for the United States to become the AI capital of the world, unleash energy dominance, bring down energy costs, and protect jobs, ‚Äúwe are not going to regulate out of existence entire sectors of our economy, and we are not going to interpret law in whichever vague, creative way allows us to give ourselves maximum power.‚Äù He said the agency‚Äôs plan is still just a proposal at this stage and will be open for public comment, with a final decision to follow after the comment period ends. Environmental groups have criticized the plans. The Environmental Defense Fund said on X last month that the proposal would ‚Äúput millions in harm‚Äôs way,‚Äù calling it the administration‚Äôs ‚Äúmost environmentally destructive action yet.‚Äù The organization said that the EPA‚Äôs actions would lead to more pollution, stronger hurricanes, more powerful floods, and more frequent fires, as well as causing higher insurance and increasing fuel costs for Americans. T.J. Muscaro and Jackson Richman contributed to this report. Tyler Durden Mon, 08/04/2025 - 13:25

title: Ditching NYC For China Saved Her Finances ‚Äî Here's How She's Living Large On $30K
Stripper Index Doesn't Apply To Bitcoin, OnlyFans Models Say
summary: Stripper Index Doesn't Apply To Bitcoin, OnlyFans Models Say div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-
fullContent: Stripper Index Doesn't Apply To Bitcoin, OnlyFans Models Say The "stripper index‚Äù - an anecdotal measurement that connects economic health with spending on adult entertainment - appears unable to predict Bitcoin‚Äôs price. Only indicator that actually matters: if this breaks support, recession guaranteed pic.twitter.com/BgNlUv0grZ ‚Äî zerohedge (@zerohedge) July 8, 2025 As CoinTelegraph reports, Kodi Rose (guessing here, but that's probably not her real name), a self-described ‚Äúdollar stripper‚Äù and adult content creator, alluded to these frontline insights in a recent viral TikTok video, saying she believes the economy is already in a recession as fewer customers are asking where they can ‚Äúhit the slopes,‚Äù a social code for cocaine. The digital equivalent of exotic dancers is adult content creators, and OnlyFans dominates the space. On the platform, users subscribe to creators and tip for extras. Turns out the stripper index doesn‚Äôt really work for Bitcoin. A 57-month revenue analysis of one mid-tier OnlyFans creator shows a negative correlation with Bitcoin‚Äôs price, despite the two moving in the same direction more than half the time. To understand whether creators‚Äô income holds any predictive value for Bitcoin, Cointelegraph spoke to veterans in the adult entertainment industry who‚Äôve weathered both its ups and downs alongside crypto‚Äôs hype cycles. Bitcoin followed OnlyFans model‚Äôs earnings 55% of the time The stripper index is backed by the assumption that consumers will cut down on non-essential spending during economic downturns. ‚ÄúSex work is considered a ‚Äònon-essential‚Äô service ‚Äî it‚Äôs entertainment, a luxury. Therefore, it‚Äôs one of the first expenses people cut when their financial situation becomes uncertain or they anticipate economic instability,‚Äù Catherine De Noire, an OnlyFans creator and brothel manager, told Cointelegraph. Alana Nguyen, who performs on OnlyFans under the stage name ‚ÄúNerdy Dancing,‚Äù shared her monthly earnings with Cointelegraph since moving online after the 2020 pandemic shut down of the physical world, including strip clubs. So far, she hasn‚Äôt noticed any clear correlation between crypto prices and subscriber behavior. Nguyen‚Äôs revenue before taxes and expenses, but after a 20% cut to OnlyFans. Source: Nerdy Dancing ‚ÄúEven if there are global economic conditions affecting overall spending, I don‚Äôt think crypto prices correlate strongly with my earnings,‚Äù Nguyen told Cointelegraph. A Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.335 over 57 months suggests a moderately negative linear relationship between Nguyen‚Äôs earnings and Bitcoin‚Äôs price. A 10-month rolling Pearson correlation between Nguyen‚Äôs earnings and Bitcoin‚Äôs price showed considerable volatility over time. The highest correlation was observed in the 10-month period ending July 2021, which were the first months of Nguyen‚Äôs business. Out of 48 total calculations, the rolling correlation coefficient was evenly split, with 24 positive and 24 negative values, suggesting the relationship between Nguyen‚Äôs earnings and Bitcoin‚Äôs price fluctuated without a consistent pattern. The rolling correlation rarely went above 0.5 or below -0.5, indicating low correlation. Each 10-month window contains a small sample size, so these results should be viewed as indicative rather than statistically conclusive. In a separate measurement, Cointelegraph analyzed whether or not Nguyen‚Äôs earnings rose when Bitcoin‚Äôs monthly average rose compared to the previous month and when her revenue dropped as Bitcoin dropped. In this measurement, the two moved toward the same direction almost half the time, with 55% accuracy over 57 months. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always thought concepts like the stripper index are only useful in terms of aggregate spending. Even in the strip club, my earnings aren‚Äôt necessarily tied to how the club is doing overall. It‚Äôs more about my personal selling ability that day ‚Äî whether regulars come in or I get lucky with a big spender,‚Äù Nguyen said. OnlyFans is notorious for opaque financial reporting. One website, OnlyGuider, claims to have analyzed the transaction behavior of over 1 million subscribers and found that the top 0.1% of creators earn the majority of the platform‚Äôs revenue. According to data from OnlyGuider shared with Cointelegraph, the top 0.1% of creators earned $2,035,331 in April 2025, when Bitcoin‚Äôs average price was $94,207. As Bitcoin prices continued to rise in May and June, earnings for the top 0.1% also increased, reaching $2,038,972 in May and $2,052,502 in June. Most OnlyFans subscribers spend their money on top models. Source: OnlyGuider Bitcoin‚Äôs relationship with OnlyFans and adult entertainment Crypto was once seen as an alternative tool for facilitating payments to adult content creators. Pornhub, one of the industry‚Äôs largest platforms, began accepting cryptocurrency as early as 2018. OnlyFans, however, has taken a different path and does not offer crypto as a payment method. ‚ÄúCrypto payments are not very popular in our brothel. Most clients prefer cash because it leaves no trace. Only a very small number of the women working with us accept crypto payments, and even then, the total number of transactions per year is extremely low,‚Äù De Noire said. ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt noticed any significant change in spending behavior that corresponds with crypto fluctuations. Whether Bitcoin or Ethereum is performing well or not doesn‚Äôt seem to have a direct effect on how much our clients are willing to spend,‚Äù she added. Erotic film star Allie Eve Knox has stronger ties to the crypto community as an advocate for integrating cryptocurrency into the adult industry and through her involvement with SpankChain, which launched initiatives like SpankPay, a crypto payment option for adult creators that has since been discontinued. Knox, who offers her content on several platforms, including OnlyFans, agreed that the price of Bitcoin doesn‚Äôt appear to have a meaningful impact on her earnings. ‚ÄúAnytime crypto hits an all-time high, our traffic actually slows,‚Äù Knox told Cointelegraph. ‚ÄúPeople want to see the biggest number in their account and screenshot it. It‚Äôs not typical for them to go passing out money to get their wanks.‚Äù Knox has been in the adult entertainment industry for 11 years and says she‚Äôs experienced 36 account closures over her career ‚Äî from bank accounts to Cash App and PayPal. Crypto offered an alternative way to accept payments, but ironically, she claims she was de-banked even by crypto platforms. ‚ÄúI showed a Showtime documentary crew how I could display my Coinbase QR code on camera, and viewers could pay me in Bitcoin or Ether. The day after it aired, Coinbase shut my account down.‚Äù Modern payment options ‚Äî whether crypto or digital banking ‚Äî make transactions easier for both consumers and businesses. However, electronic methods still draw scrutiny from banks when used by sex workers. In brothels, clients often prefer cash, sometimes even leaving mid-session to withdraw money from an ATM, De Noire said. ‚ÄúAs an OnlyFans creator, however, I notice something a little bit similar. My subscribers generally have no issue using credit cards and trust the platform. Yet many of them still ask if they can pay via Bitcoin or other alternative methods,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúSince OF doesn‚Äôt allow payments outside the platform, I haven‚Äôt pursued this further, but it‚Äôs clear that even online clients are looking for more privacy and control over the data they share with financial institutions.‚Äù Bitcoin‚Äôs honeymoon with OnlyFans models has passed Web3 and adult content had their ‚Äúgood old days,‚Äù according to Knox, who says the non-fungible token (NFT) boom of 2021 opened up new income streams and gave creators more options to reach fans and spend their crypto earnings. ‚ÄúNow, if a customer doesn‚Äôt already hold crypto, they have to move money from their bank, wait for it to clear into a wallet, maybe convert it, send it to a model, wait for confirmation and only then do they get the content,‚Äù she said. Creators are also facing increasing barriers worldwide. Recently, China launched a nationwide crackdown on OnlyFans, while Sweden, a nation that‚Äôs politically and culturally very different from China, has imposed restrictions on purchasing adult content. SpankPay cited a hostile regulatory climate as the reason for winding down its payment service. Source: SpankPay De Noire cited sociologist Zygmunt Bauman to point out that in today‚Äôs society, consumers aren‚Äôt just trying to survive, but they prioritize enjoyment. ‚ÄúWhen you see a lot of non-essential services like massages, fancy coffee, wellness retreats or even sex work being used regularly, it‚Äôs a sign that the society has enough money going around,‚Äù De Noire said. While cryptocurrency was once hailed as a promising payment solution for adult content creators facing financial censorship, the reality is more complex. Despite pockets of overlap, such as simultaneous rises in Bitcoin prices and earnings among top OnlyFans creators, adult entertainers and their earnings have shown little correlation with Bitcoin‚Äôs price trends. Tyler Durden Mon, 08/04/2025 - 13:00

title: The Global Energy Shift Is Happening‚ÄîQuietly but Surely
summary: At first glance, the energy transition seems stuck in reverse: fossil fuels still dominate, political winds have shifted, and crises abound. Global energy headlines fixate on wars, inflation, and shifting priorities.
fullContent: At first glance, the energy transition seems stuck in reverse: fossil fuels still dominate, political winds have shifted, and crises abound. Global energy headlines fixate on wars, inflation, and shifting priorities. Yet beneath the noise, something far more powerful is happening: renewables are growing, almost entirely on their own, while fossil fuels creep toward irrelevance. Fossils still dominate... but only in headline share Critics point out that fossil fuels still supply roughly 80?percent of global primary energy, only a bit down from 85?percent‚Ä¶
